section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 7. Chapter 7: Diseases of the Eye and Adnexa > a. Glaucoma > 5) Indeterminate stage glaucoma

content.full_text: Assignment of the seventh character "4" for "indeterminate stage" should be based on the clinical documentation. The seventh character "4" is used for glaucomas whose stage cannot be clinically determined. This seventh character should not be confused with the seventh character "0", unspecified, which should be assigned when there is no documentation regarding the stage of the glaucoma. (Evidence: pg no: 49, L32)
content.summary: Seventh character "4" for indeterminate stage is used when glaucoma stage cannot be clinically determined, distinct from "0" for unspecified when no documentation exists (Evidence: pg no: 49, L32)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Seventh character "4" (indeterminate) differs from "0" (unspecified) - use "0" when no documentation exists (Evidence: pg no: 49, L32)
detailed_rules.explanation: Indeterminate (4) means clinical determination is impossible despite documentation, while unspecified (0) means no documentation about staging exists (Evidence: pg no: 49, L32)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Review clinical documentation for glaucoma staging information
Step 2: Determine if clinical assessment was attempted
Step 3: If assessment attempted but stage cannot be determined, use "4"
Step 4: If no documentation about staging exists, use "0"
Step 5: Ensure choice reflects documentation reality
